definitions: put forward a topic or idea for debate consideration or discussion
examples: The professor mooted several controversial theories during the lecture
She mooted the possibility of changing our vacation plans

definitions: clean a floor or surface using a cloth attached to a handle
wipe sweat or liquid from face or skin using absorbent material
examples: I need to mop the kitchen floor after spilling juice
The janitor mops the hallways every evening after school
She mopped her forehead with a handkerchief in the heat
The boxer's coach mopped his face between rounds

definitions: change smoothly from one form shape or state into another different one
examples: The caterpillar will morph into a butterfly over several weeks
His casual blog morphed into a successful online business

definitions: attack a place or enemy position using explosive shells fired from mortars
examples: Enemy forces mortared our base throughout the night
The rebels mortared the government compound from nearby hills

definitions: travel on a two-wheeled motor vehicle as driver or passenger
examples: She motorbikes to work every day to avoid traffic
They motorbiked across the country during their summer vacation

definitions: move across water in a boat powered by an engine or motor
examples: We motorboated across the lake to reach the island
They motorboat to their cabin every weekend during summer

definitions: travel on a two-wheeled motor vehicle as driver or passenger
examples: He motorcycles through the mountains on weekends for relaxation
They motorcycled from coast to coast raising money for charity

definitions: shape a soft substance into a particular form using hands or container
develop a fuzzy growth of fungus on damp or decaying material
examples: She moulded the clay into a beautiful vase shape
The baker moulds the dough into different bread shapes
Old bread will mould if left in humid conditions
The cheese moulded after being forgotten in the refrigerator

definitions: slowly rot or crumble away through natural decay over time
examples: Ancient books moulder in the abandoned library basement
The old wooden fence mouldered away after years of neglect

definitions: lose old feathers fur or skin naturally to make way for new growth
examples: Birds moult their feathers twice a year in most species
Our dog moults heavily during the spring and autumn months

definitions: heap or stack something into a raised pile or small hill
examples: She mounded the mashed potatoes on each dinner plate
Workers mounded the sand to create barriers against flooding

definitions: climb mountains as a sport or recreational activity requiring special equipment
examples: They mountaineer in the Alps every summer vacation
She learned to mountaineer safely with experienced guides

definitions: feel or show deep sorrow for someone who has died or something lost
examples: The whole nation mourned the death of their beloved leader
She still mourns the loss of her childhood home

definitions: apply a foamy styling product to hair for volume and hold
examples: She mousses her curly hair to keep it from frizzing
The stylist moussed his hair before using the blow dryer

definitions: cut grass or vegetation to a uniform short length using a machine
examples: I mow the lawn every Saturday morning during summer
The groundskeeper mows the soccer field twice each week

definitions: cover or soil something with dirt mud or filthy substances
spend time doing unimportant things or behaving in a silly way
examples: The children mucked their clothes playing in the muddy yard
Don't muck the clean floor with your dirty boots
Stop mucking about and finish your homework assignments
They mucked around at the beach all afternoon

definitions: mix things up in a confused or disorganized way causing disorder
cope with a situation despite being confused or lacking proper organization
examples: Don't muddle the filing system by putting papers randomly
She muddled all the appointment times in her calendar
We'll muddle through somehow despite not having clear instructions
He muddled along in his new job until gaining experience

definitions: make something dirty with mud or make water or liquid cloudy
examples: The dog muddied the clean kitchen floor with wet paws
Heavy rain muddied the clear stream water

definitions: fail to catch hold or deal with something properly through clumsiness
examples: The goalkeeper muffed an easy save costing the game
She muffed her lines during the important audition

definitions: attack someone violently in a public place to steal their belongings
examples: Two men mugged him outside the subway station last night
Tourists sometimes get mugged in poorly lit areas

definitions: spread protective material around plants to retain moisture and prevent weeds
examples: We mulch our garden beds every spring with wood chips
The landscaper mulched around the newly planted trees

definitions: think about something carefully and at length before making a decision
examples: She mulled over the job offer for several days
He's still mulling whether to accept the scholarship

definitions: calculate the result when one number is added to itself multiple times
increase greatly in number or reproduce to create many offspring quickly
examples: Students learn to multiply numbers in elementary mathematics class
Multiply six by seven to get forty-two
Bacteria multiply rapidly in warm moist conditions
Their problems multiplied when they lost their jobs

definitions: eat something steadily with a regular chewing action often making noise
examples: The rabbit munched on fresh carrots from the garden
Children munched popcorn while watching the movie

definitions: say something in a quiet indistinct voice that is difficult to hear
examples: She murmured words of comfort to the crying child
Students murmured among themselves during the test

definitions: think about something in a deep quiet and reflective way
examples: She mused about what her life might have been
The philosopher mused on the meaning of existence

definitions: travel over snow with a sled pulled by dogs while commanding them
examples: They mushed across the frozen tundra for three days
He learned to mush during his winter in Alaska

definitions: increase expand or develop very quickly in size number or importance
examples: The small business mushroomed into a global corporation
Housing developments mushroomed around the new subway station

definitions: collect or summon up strength courage or resources often with difficulty
examples: She mustered all her courage to speak in public
The team couldn't muster enough energy for a comeback

definitions: undergo genetic change resulting in new characteristics or forms in organisms
examples: Viruses mutate rapidly making vaccines less effective over time
The bacteria mutated to become resistant to antibiotics

definitions: turn off or reduce sound from a device or stop someone from speaking
examples: Please mute your microphone during the online presentation
She muted the television to answer an important phone call

definitions: refuse to obey orders and try to take control especially on a ship
examples: The crew mutinied against their cruel captain at sea
Soldiers mutinied when ordered to attack their own citizens

definitions: speak in a low unclear voice often expressing dissatisfaction or annoyance
examples: He muttered complaints under his breath about the delay
She muttered something about being treated unfairly

definitions: prevent someone from expressing their opinions freely or silence them forcefully
examples: The government tried to muzzle journalists reporting the scandal
They muzzled witnesses by threatening their families

definitions: catch or arrest someone suddenly or seize something quickly
examples: Police nabbed the thief as he left the store
She nabbed the last ticket before they sold out

definitions: repeatedly criticize or complain to someone about their behavior or actions
examples: She nags him constantly about leaving dishes in the sink
My parents nag me to find a better paying job

definitions: sleep for a short period during the day outside normal sleeping hours
examples: Toddlers usually nap for two hours after lunch
He naps on the couch every Sunday afternoon

definitions: provide spoken commentary or tell a story giving details of events
examples: She narrates audiobooks for a major publishing company
The documentary was narrated by a famous actor

definitions: transfer ownership of private industry or property to government control
examples: The government nationalized the oil industry during the crisis
Several countries nationalized their railway systems after the war

definitions: plan and direct the route or course of a ship aircraft or vehicle
find a way through a difficult or complicated situation or system
examples: She navigated the ship through dangerous waters using charts
Pilots navigate using sophisticated computer systems
It's hard to navigate the complex healthcare system alone
He navigated office politics carefully to get promoted

definitions: make something necessary as a result or consequence of particular circumstances
examples: The storm damage necessitated expensive repairs to the roof
Budget cuts necessitate reducing staff by twenty percent

definitions: nullify or cancel out the effect or value of something
examples: His rude behavior negated all his earlier good impressions
One mistake can negate years of hard work

definitions: fail to give proper care attention or maintenance to someone or something
examples: Some parents neglect their children's emotional needs
If you neglect your health problems will develop

definitions: be situated next to or very near another place or thing
examples: Our property neighbours the national park on two sides
France neighbours several countries including Spain and Germany

definitions: settle into a comfortable position or place something in a protected spot
examples: The cat nestled into her favorite blanket for warmth
The cottage nestles among pine trees by the lake

definitions: gain or produce as profit after all costs and deductions are made
examples: The business netted fifty thousand dollars last quarter
She netted a good profit from selling her paintings

definitions: make someone feel annoyed irritated or slightly angry about something
examples: His dismissive comments really nettled her during the meeting
It nettles me when people arrive late without apologizing

definitions: surgically remove reproductive organs from an animal to prevent breeding
examples: The vet will neuter your cat at six months old
Animal shelters neuter pets before putting them up for adoption

definitions: stop something from having an effect or make it chemically neutral
examples: The medicine neutralises stomach acid to relieve heartburn
Special forces neutralised the terrorist threat before dawn

definitions: stop something from having an effect or make it chemically neutral
examples: Baking soda neutralizes odors in the refrigerator naturally
The defense neutralized their opponent's star player completely
